contentrichtext.text: {{Politics of Mali}} {{stack|{{Regions of Mali Image Map}}}} [[Mali]] is divided into eight [[region]]s and one [[district|capital district]]. Each of the regions bears the name of its principal city. The regions are divided into 49 [[Cercles of Mali|cercles]]. The cercles and the capital district are divided into 703 [[Communes of Mali|communes]].<ref>{{citation|year=1999| title= Loi N°99-035/ Du 10 Aout 1999 Portant Creation des Collectivites Territoriales de Cercles et de Regions | url=http://www.matcl.gov.ml/PDF/LoiCreationCercleReg.pdf |publisher=Ministère de l'Administration Territoriales et des Collectivités Locales, République du Mali | language=French }}.</ref> The regions are numbered, originally west to east, with [[Roman numerals]].<ref>[http://www.diplomatie.gouv.fr/fr/ministere_817/publications_827/cooperation-internationale-developpement_3030/serie-evaluations_4632/evaluations-2003_4660/evaluation-cooperation-decentralisee-franco-malienne_4663/cooperation-decentralisee-franco-malienne-etat-lieux_11737.html Évaluation de la coopération décentralisée franco-malienne La coopération décentralisée franco-malienne, état des lieux], Ministère des Affaires étrangères et européennes (French Ministry of Foreign Affairs).</ref> The capital [[Bamako]] is administered separately and is in its own District. The eight regions and the Bamako District are listed below. The population figures are from the 1998 and 2009 censuses.<ref>{{citation | url=http://instat.gov.ml/documentation/mali.pdf | publisher=République de Mali: Institut National de la Statistique| title=Resultats Provisoires RGPH 2009 | language=French }}.</ref> {| class="sortable wikitable" !
